Preprocessing¶

Read Data¶

Data Profile¶

Information describing the statistic of variables in the data.

preprocessor.dataprofile(dataframe):
Parameters

dataframe – dataframe

Return type

A dataframe with data dictionary

Missing Values¶

Function to handle missing values by replacing them with a statistic or user specified value or methods such as back fill and front fill.

preprocessor.treat_missing_data(dataframe, column, **kwargs):
Parameters

  • dataframe – dataframe

  • column – list of columns/column to treat missing data

**kwargs

Parameters

  • statistic (str) – min/max/mean/median/quantilevalue

  • value (int) – user specified value

  • fill_method (str) – bfill/ffill (bfill - backward fill, ffill - front fill)

Return type

a list of series of the columns where the missing values are imputed

Note

Only one param can be used in statistic, value & fill_method. For categorical variables, most repeated value is default value for filling missing values.

Treat Outliers¶

Function to handle outliers in the data by either removing them or replacing them with a specific value (user specified value or statistic)

preprocessor.treat_outliers(dataframe, column, **kwargs):
Parameters

  • dataframe – dataframe

  • column – list of columns/column to treat outliers

**kwargs

Parameters

  • remove (bool) – True if the outliers should be removed form the data

  • statistic (str) – min/max/mean/median/quantilevalue

  • value (int) – bfill/ffill (bfill - backward fill, ffill - front fill)

Return type

Dataframe with outliers treated.

Feature Creation¶

Creates new features based on existing columns using methods such as binning, one-hot-encoding & groupby transform

binning - bins a numerical variable based on user specified value. one-hot-encoding - Process in the data processing that is applied to categorical data, to convert it into a binary vector representation. groupby - groupby transform returns a self-produced dataframe with transformed values after applying the function specified in its parameter.

preprocessor.feature_creation(dataframe, feature_method, binning_column=None, bins=10,
binning_right=True, binning_labels=None,
binning_retbins=False, binning_precision=3, binning_include_lowest=False,
binning_duplicates='raise', binning_ordered=True, dummies_prefix=None, dummies_prefix_sep='_',
dummies_dummy_na=False, dummies_column=None, dummies_sparse=False, dummies_drop_first=False,
groupby_column=None, groupby_transform_column=None, groupby_transform_metric='mean'):
Parameters

  • dataframe – dataframe

  • feature_method – binning/one-hot-encoding/groupby

binning

Parameters

  • binning_column –

  • bins – Number of equal width bins. Default - 10

  • binning_right – bool, default True. Indicates if the bins should include the right most value.

  • binning_labels – array or bool, optional. Labels for the returned bins

  • binning_retbins –

  • binning_precision –

  • binning_include_lowest –

  • binning_duplicates –

one-hot-encoding

Parameters

  • dummies_prefix –

  • dummies_prefix_sep –

  • dummies_dummy_na –

  • dummies_sparse –

  • dummies_drop_first –

groupby

Parameters

  • groupby_column – list of columns to groupby in the dataframe

  • groupby_transform_column – column to perform the transform operation on

  • groupby_transform_metric – metric to use for transformation - min/max/mean/median

Data Transformation¶

Converts data from one format to another

pivot - melt - crosstab -

preprocessor.feature_creation(dataframe, transform_method, pivot_index=None, pivot_columns=None, pivot_values=None,

melt_id_vars=None, melt_value_vars=None, crosstab_columns=None, crosstab_rows=None
